isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: BENDIX 2150 - OPERATION - INLET CHECK VALVE

svcproc.title: INLET CHECK VALVE
svcproc.para: An inlet check valve is used on some naturally aspirated BX-2150 compressors (never with pressurized induction, see number 3 above) to prevent inlet oil misting during the unloaded cycle. The inlet check valve is mounted directly at the inlet cavity of the compressor. lt consists of three parts, the inlet gasket, the inlet check valve reed, and the inlet check valve seat ( Figure 8). During the compression cycle, the inlet check valve reed is drawn away from its seat uncovering three inlet holes which allows air to flow into the compressor inlet cavity. A machined stop in the cylinder head inlet cavity limits the travel of the inlet check valve reed. in the unloaded cycle the inlet check valve reed rests on its seat covering the three inlet holes. Air from within the compressor is prevented from exiting the inlet cavity.

The inlet check valve may only be used in conjunction with cylinder heads incorporating the machined inlet check valve stop in the inlet cavity. Inlet gasket (Bendix 243430) is required since its thickness contributes to the minimum reed travel required. Either side of the inlet check valve reed may be installed next to the gasket; however, the free end (tip) of the inlet check valve reed must coincide with the machined inlet cavity stop in the cylinder head. The inlet check valve seat must be installed, so that the two "half moon" indentations are on the side facing the inlet check valve as illustrated in Figure 8.
